sentences.sContent: The sanatorium stood on a large plot of land by the coast.
sentences.sContent_eng: The sanatorium stood on a large plot of land by the coast.
sentences.sCn: 疗养院坐落在海岸的一片宽阔的土地上。

sentences.sContent: More British wildlife is likely to be nursed in some bucolic sanatorium in the hope of populating the future.
sentences.sContent_eng: More British wildlife is likely to be nursed in some bucolic sanatorium in the hope of populating the future.
sentences.sCn: 为了保持物种数量，更多的英国野生动物可能会在某些“乡村疗养院”中被照顾起来。

sentences.sContent: Orwell writes this from the sanatorium at Preston Hall, Aylesford, Kent. If you can't hyperlink from ‘the drive’ in the post, go to Google Maps on the blogroll.
sentences.sContent_eng: Orwell writes this from the sanatorium at Preston Hall, Aylesford, Kent. If you can't hyperlink from ‘the drive’ in the post, go to Google Maps on the blogroll.
sentences.sCn: 写这篇日记时，奥威尔住在肯特郡阿里斯福德的普雷斯顿疗养院。请点击“路边的草丛”上的超链接在谷歌地图中查看位置。

trans.tranOther: a type of hospital for sick people who are getting better after a long illness but still need rest and a lot of care
